glossdef.para: A program for organizing the data on your computer. There are many different approaches: mouse centric, keyboard centric. Spatial memory centric. Expert tool. User friendly tools.
Apple's file manager is "The Finder". It has really nice drag and drop. It gets a lot of attention from computer magazines whenever Apple makes a tiny change to it.
ls is a commandline program for listing directory contents.
Newton Commander. The name of this program. Also the same shortname for the legendary Norton Commander that you typed in to start the program.
Perhaps the first dual pane file manager. It was for MSDOS and dissapeared around the time Windows95 took over the world. Extremely popular.
Commander-like file managers. That have two panels. Have the same keybindings for F1-F10. Same keyboard navigation.

An Apple technology that is VERY important in file managers. It allows you to view the file content without opening the file. However there are only a few quicklook plugins installed per default, so it's up to you to obtain the plugins you need.
Switch user. If no argument is specified you will be logged in as root.
Execute a command as the super user.
A dual pane file manager for windows. After Norton Commander ruled the MSDOS world, came Total Commander and now rules the Windows world.
Microsoft's file manager is named "Windows Explorer".
